dummy-texts.controller-text:
<?php
class %sController extends Controller{
	public function __construct(array $data = array())
	{
		parent::__construct($data);
		$this->model = new PagesMode();
	}
	public function index(){
		$this->data['title'] = 'Pages Index Title';
	}
}

help-strings.create-view:
Create View Command accepts two arguement (view-name and controller-name) 
The Command should be Writen as follow
php flo create:view page-name controller-name
for example: 'php flo create:view index pages' which index is the view of pages controller http://website.com/pages/index
help-strings.create-controller:
Create Controller Command accepts one arguement (controller-name) 
The Command should be Writen as follow
php flo create:controller controller-name
for example: 'php flo create:controller pages' which pages is a controller http://website.com/pages
